summary: This document is a declaration by Steven Hayes, a Sprint subpoena specialist, certifying compliance with a grand jury subpoena dated August 13, 2019, issued by Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos. It authenticates records provided by Sprint in response to the subpoena under Federal Rules of Evidence.

persons.name: Steven Hayes
persons.context: Declares as the custodian of records for Sprint, certifying the authenticity and business practices of records provided in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated August 13, 2019, requesting specified records from Sprint as part of an investigation.

connections.description: Roos, as an AUSA, issued a grand jury subpoena to Sprint, and Hayes, as custodian of records, certified the responsive records.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Sprint
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos signed a grand jury subpoena requesting specified records from Sprint.

events.title: Declaration of Custodian of Records Executed
events.description: Steven Hayes executed this declaration certifying the authenticity and business practices of records provided by Sprint in response to the subpoena.

locations.context: Business address of Sprint, the company from which records were subpoenaed.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Sprint on August 13, 2019, by Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos as part of an investigation.
Steven Hayes, a Sprint subpoena specialist, certified the authenticity of Sprint's records provided in response to the subpoena under Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6).
The declaration was executed on August 15, 2019, indicating a rapid response to the subpoena within two days.
The document demonstrates law enforcement's use of legal process to obtain business records from telecommunications companies during the Epstein investigation.
